p: Plants belonging to Argemone genus are important medicinal plants [ 13]. Several traditional uses were described from these plants, such as expectorant, demulcent, diuretic, emetic, and treatment in chronic skin diseases [ 14]. The oils from A. mexicana seeds were widely used in the treatment of several diseases like intestinal infections, ulcers, dysentery, asthma, and hypertension [ 15, 16, 17]. Leaves, seeds, and flowers of A. mexicana were stated to have numerous medicinal uses, such as coughs, and maintenance of blood cholesterol and normal circulation as well as anti-venom [ 18, 19, 20, 21]. The chemical characterization of Argemone plant species afforded various metabolites, such as terpenoids, alkaloids, phenolics, and flavonoids [ 14].
